SENT.plain: We studied 35 patients with nonseptic cardiogenic cerebral emboli
In 28 cases, there was sudden onset with maximal neurologic deficit within 1 hour; in 7 cases, there was progression in 24 hours
In six cases, neurologic abnormality worsened in the first week after an initial period of stabilization
CT showed evidence of a cerebral infarct in all cases; in nine cases, this was hemorrhagic
There was more than one lesion in six cases
In four of the six cases with delayed neurologic deterioration, later CT showed increased mass effect or recent hemorrhage within the infarct
